results.title: B.L.A.C.K.: an Aboriginal song of hip hop
results.creator_credit: Roslyn Baker, Grant Saunders and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
B.L.A.C.K. is a cipher scribed by independent and Indigenous Hip Hop artist, Wire MC. Through interviews and observation the song is visually and dialectically deconstructed to speak of contemporary issues around Aboriginal blackness, politics and culture.
The filmmaker, with his own roots in Hip Hop, aligns himself with Wire MC and through a rapped narrative adds another layer of complexity to notions of blackness by pulling apart his own identity.
This is a musical documentary that exposes an authentic and empowering B.L.A.C.K. voice existing underneath the hype of “bling-bling” hip hop. This is a film with rhythm, rhyme and reason.
results.title_for_label: B.L.A.C.K.: an Aboriginal song of hip hop

This is a musical documentary that exposes an authentic and empowering B.L.A.C.K. voice existing underneath the hype of “bling-bling” hip hop. This is a film with rhythm, rhyme and reason.

results.title: Arcadia
results.creator_credit: Greg Waters, Paola Garofali, Adrian Wills and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
‘I know that you’re there, because I can feel you. Why don’t you come out and play with me. In the dark I hear you breathing. Watch out for the Hairy Man…’
In Arcadia nothing is what it seems.
Cast: Hunter Page, Justine Saunders, Ursula Yovich, Damien Garvey, Pauline Lampton

results.title: Agnes, Maude and Pearly too
results.creator_credit: Kate Gillick, Charles Mitchell, Aline Jacques, Erica Glynn and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
On this day, in loving memory of Pearly, Agnes and Maude play a game on Pearly’s favourite poker machine. But when they hit the jackpot, money isn’t the only thing that comes spilling out.
Cast: Julie Godfrey (Agnes), Jacquy Phillips (Maude)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kate Gillick, Charles Mitchell, Aline Jacques, Erica Glynn and AFTRS
results.description:

results.title: Dogfood
results.brief_description: Watching TV, driving around, eating peanut butter, trying to get a job. A film about the sort of people who live in the suburbs.

results.title: The Colonel
results.creator_credit: Jenifer Hooks, Rolf De Heer and AFTRS
results.brief_description: An army colonel, having outlived his usefulness to the revolution, is imprisoned. Refusing to sign a false confession, he is eventually forced into a position of choice - his principles or his life.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jenifer Hooks, Rolf De Heer and AFTRS

results.title: Morris loves Jack
results.brief_description:
Morris loves Jack - or does he?
Jack is a young, dedicated policewoman who lives with Morris, a charming but lazy layabout. But he has become a habit she can’t break and so she puts up with the frustrations and disappointments of living with him - until one night the police are called to a noisy party…Cast includes Kris McQuade, John Hargreaves, Bill Hunter and David Boyd.

results.title: Distinguished guests
results.creator_credit: Loretta Fisher, P.J. Hogan, Louise Meek and AFTRS
results.brief_description: Christopher (Colin Friels) is sure he really likes psychology - but not the way it is taught at his university. Professor Wiseman, his tutor, is a disciple of the eminent European pyschologist, Professor Eisenbach - a cold rational behaviourist whose books are always cited as authorities. As a joke, Christopher and his girlfriend decide that he will impersonate Eisenbach and teach Professor Wiseman a lesson. Co-written by PJ Hogan (Muriel’s Wedding). Also features Tracy Mann.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Loretta Fisher, P.J. Hogan, Louise Meek and AFTRS
